column4: Hiya does anyone know how i can remove all of the kde programs without removing the desktop environment itself
then either uninstall them, or use alacarte / kmenuedit   to remove them
its the problem with installing the metapackage if youo just want the desktop
like if people just want xfce desktop I dont advise they install xubuntu-desktop   its massive, you can install xfce4 get the desktop but not so many of the apps which keeps things nice and neat
right click desktop -> add panel
nar, much simpler
Right so what exactly do i need on the bar again, window list, show desktop button, that's it isn't it?
http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=288042    is like net send
do you have 3D asccelleration setup?
if you press ALT+F2 and type: compiz --replace     does it all enable?
Yup I got it all working fine before, rotate cuve was working just all resets after reboot
After I set it again everything works fine, I am using proprietary ati drivers on a radeon hd 5750 by the way
then add a startup entry to run the command, all done
Oh ok then awesome, it's just last time I had compiz working and i didn't need to add that command it did everything automatically
thats all i can suggest. personally i dont use compiz at all
Ok thanks for all your help :D
Ah, but google is the best
